author: The Canadian Press
description: Vice-Admiral Angus Topshee said he has made it clear he wants “no changes” to the design of the submarines Canada intends to buy, due to the highly complex nature of the war machines. “I have been as explicit as possible that there are no changes to the design,” Topshee said Wednesday. “If you have ever […]
title: Navy Commander Insists Canada Should Buy Unmodified Submarines

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Six people have been charged, including one teenager who is wanted, in connection with an August home invasion near Toronto that left a father of four dead. Mississauga resident Amir Wiam Mohammad Abuhmaid, 26, is charged with first-degree murder in the Aug. 31 shooting death of 46-year-old Aleem Farooqi, York Regional Police said in a […]
title: 5 Charged, 16‑Year‑Old Sought in Deadly Vaughan Home Invasion

author: Epoch Times Staff
description: A glimpse into the world through the lens of photography.
title: Day in Photos: Turkish Plane Crash, 70th Anniversary of Bundeswehr, and Southern Lights

author: Rachel Roberts
description: The protesters had traveled 30 days by ship to make their point on deforestation to the delegates and world leaders gathered in Belem.
title: Indigenous Activists Breach UN Security at Climate Summit

author: Eva Fu, Nicholas Zifcak
description: Linda Sun is accused of selling her political access in exchange for millions of dollars in payments to her husband’s business. She has pleaded not guilty.
title: Ex-Hochul Aide, Accused of Selling Out to China, Heads to Trial

author: Olivia Gomm
description: Canada’s premiers have outlined their top priorities for discussions with Prime Minister Mark Carney during their meeting next week, including infrastructure funding and the state of Canada’s trade relations with the United States. The prime minister is set to host a virtual first ministers meeting with Canada’s provincial and territorial leaders on Nov. 17, and […]
title: Premiers Ask for Update on US Trade, Infrastructure Funding Ahead of Carney Meeting

author: Noé Chartier
description: Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre says he won’t be changing his leadership style and that now-Liberal MP Chris d’Entremont’s comments on the matter won’t lead to more Tory MPs crossing the floor. Poilievre made the comments when asked by reporters on Nov. 12 if has reflected on his leadership style following d’Entremont’s defection. “My plan is […]
title: Poilievre Says d’Entremont Joining Liberals Won’t Lead to More Defections

author: Chandra Philip
description: The Montreal city transit maintenance workers’ union says it is suspending its month-long strike as the province’s labour minister prepares to introduce back-to-work legislation. The union, Syndicat du transport de Montréal–CSN, made the announcement on Nov. 11, while the transit agency, Société de transport de Montréal (STM) said buses would start running at 6:15 a.m. […]
title: Montreal Transit Strike Ends as Maintenance Workers’ Union Suspends Strike

author: Jill McLaughlin
description: The World Health Organization fears a massive loss of funding this year could impede future progress.
title: Global Tuberculosis Deaths Declined in 2024: WHO Report

author: Victoria Friedman
description: In July, 72 cross-party members of the Knesset backed a call to include Taiwan in key international organizations such as the World Health Organization.
title: Taiwan Wants to Deepen Ties With Israel, Foreign Minister Says

author: Chandra Philip
description: A Nova Scotia restaurant owner says he was pleasantly surprised to receive a letter from an Alabama resident, along with US$40 in cash for a food order that was never picked up. Darcy Clarke, who runs Bentley’s Burgers and Fries in Halifax with his wife Laura, said he recalls the order clearly. “It was around […]
title: NS Restaurant Receives Apology, Cash for Food Order Made From Alabama

author: The Canadian Press
description: A new report says Canada saw a record-breaking $56.5 billion in private equity deals in the first nine months of the year to rise well above pre-pandemic levels. The Canadian Venture Capital and Private Equity Association says the total came as the sector recorded 483 transactions. It says much of the record was driven by […]
title: Canadian Private Equity Deals Top $56 Billion in First Nine Months: CVCA

author: The Canadian Press
description: Baytex Energy Corp. is turning its focus to Canada, announcing plans to divest its position in the Eagle Ford shale formation in Texas—the biggest part of its business—through a $3.25-billion deal. The assets being sold to an undisclosed buyer represent all of Baytex’s U.S. operations. They produced an average of almost 83,000 barrels of oil […]
title: Baytex Exits the U.S. in $3.25B Deal, Focuses on Higher-Return Canadian Assets

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney will be attending the G20 Leaders’ Summit in South Africa later this month, where he will be looking to boost trade and investment in Canada. Carney will first travel to the United Arab Emirates for a bilateral visit and then participate in the G20 leaders’ summit in Johannesburg, South Africa, from […]
title: Carney to Attend G20 Summit in South Africa, With Stop in UAE

author: Olivia Gomm
description: Foreign Affairs Minister Anita Anand met with her Indian counterpart at the G7 Foreign Ministers’ Meeting in Canada on Nov. 11, reflecting a growing “momentum” in the Canada-India bilateral relationship, Global Affairs Canada says. Anand and Indian External Affairs Minister Subrahmanyam Jaishankar discussed the progress being made on increasing co-operation between the two countries, Global […]
title: ‘Momentum’ Building in Canada-India Relations as Anand Meets Counterpart: Global Affairs

author: Matthew Horwood
description: The Canadian government has started the hiring process for a new Parliamentary Budget Officer (PBO), months after naming an interim official to the post. The description of the PBO position posted online states that the candidate will provide “non-partisan, authoritative analysis on the state of the nation’s finances, the government’s budget and estimates, and economic […]
title: Budget Watchdog Wanted: Ottawa Launches Hiring Process for Permanent PBO

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: A Vancouver woman was found stabbed to death earlier this week at the spa she owned in Belize, local police say. The body of 65-year-old Marty Thorne was discovered on Nov. 10 shortly before 8 a.m. CST at RawSpa, a wellness resort near Bullet Tree Village in the Cayo District of Belize. The spa is […]
title: Belize Police Investigating Stabbing Death of Vancouver Woman

author: The Canadian Press
description: Hudson’s Bay has gifted several war memorials from its former stores to the Royal Canadian Legion and TD Bank Group. Franco Perugini, a senior vice-president of real estate and legal at the defunct retailer, says memorial plaques in HBC’s Calgary, Winnipeg and Vancouver stores were all donated to local branches of the Royal Canadian Legion. […]
title: Hudson’s Bay Gifts War Memorials to TD Bank, Royal Canadian Legion Branches

author: Matthew Horwood
description: Foreign Affairs Minister Anita Anand announced Canada has imposed more sanctions on Russia while attending a meeting of G7 foreign ministers in Ontario’s Niagara region. “We firmly believe that continued collective pressure on Russia is necessary… So today, we are announcing a new package of sanctions to further increase the economic costs to Russia of […]
title: Canada Slaps New Sanctions on Russia, Targeting Its Drone Program

author: Guy Birchall
description: The legislation prohibits the dissemination of materials about 'non-traditional sexual-orientation' designed to 'shape positive public opinion.'
title: Kazakhstan Parliament Votes to Ban ‘LGBT Propaganda’

author: William Brooks
description: Including opposition leaders in the annual ceremony would not politicize remembrance—it would complete it.
title: The Missing Link to Democracy in Canada’s National Remembrance Day Ceremony

author: Reuters
description: LIMA–At least 37 people were killed and dozens injured after a bus plunged into a ravine in the Arequipa region of southern Peru, local authorities said on Wednesday.The fatalities included 36 people who died on site, and another person who died in hospital, said Walther Oporto, Arequipa’s regional health chief, citing firefighters at the scene […]
title: Bus Accident Kills at Least 37 in Southern Peru, Official Says

author: The Associated Press
description: ANKARA, Turkey—All 20 personnel on board a Turkish military cargo plane that crashed in Georgia were killed, Turkey’s defense minister announced on Wednesday. The C-130 plane was flying from Ganja, Azerbaijan to Turkey when it crashed in Georgia’s Sighnaghi municipality, close to the Azerbaijani border, on Tuesday. The cause of the crash is being investigated. […]
title: Turkish Military Plane Crash in Georgia Kills All 20 on Board

author: The Canadian Press
description: Holiday job postings are a little more plentiful this year, but that’s hardly a respite for job seekers as competition for those positions is expected to be tough with unemployment still elevated, a new report shows. Indeed Canada’s holiday hiring trends report released Wednesday finds seasonal postings so far this winter are up 12 percent […]
title: Holiday Job Postings up From Last Year but Finding a Job Still Challenging: Report

author: The Canadian Press
description: New polling suggests Canadians had a lukewarm response to the federal budget released last week—leading one pollster to argue all parties should think twice before mounting an election campaign over the spending plan. The Leger survey indicates some 30 percent of Canadians who responded approve of the budget tabled by Prime Minister Mark Carney’s government […]
title: Affordability Gap Leaves Liberal Budget With Middling Reviews: Leger Poll

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: The call comes as Netanyahu stands trial on bribery, fraud, and breach-of-trust charges dating back to 2019.
title: Trump Urges Israeli President to Pardon Netanyahu, Herzog’s Office Says

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: A Calgary woman missing for more than five decades has been identified as the individual whose remains were uncovered in a shallow grave on the outskirts of Henderson, Nevada, in 1970. Genetic genealogy was used to identify the remains as those of Anna Sylvia Just, an Alberta woman whose whereabouts have been a mystery for […]
title: DNA Evidence Identifies Calgary Woman as Nevada Murder Victim, Ending 55-Year Mystery

author: Naveen Athrappully
description: Afd claimed there was no misconduct on its part to warrant the account closure.
title: Germany’s AfD Party Accuses Bank of Politically Motivated Debanking

author: Guy Birchall
description: The top diplomats from the United States, the UK, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, and Canada are meeting in Ontario.
title: G7 Diplomats Meet in Canada for Talks Focused on Ukraine, Middle East

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: Thai police said the tycoon will face trial in China for running illegal casinos and gambling sites, and for using Burma as a base for money laundering.
title: Thailand Extradites Gambling Tycoon to China

author: Chris Summers
description: Prosecutor Gillian Jones KC told a court in London the Lantian Gerui investment fund, created by Qian Zhimin, was a classic Ponzi scheme.
title: UK Court Hears of 7-Year Odyssey to Find Mastermind of $5.62 Billion China Fraud

author: AAP
description: Captain Ben Stokes has strongly defended England’s unorthodox preparation for the Ashes as they aim to break a 14-year winless run in Australia. England will head into the first Test at Optus Stadium in Perth, starting on Nov. 21, having not played a warm-up game against any Australian opposition. The tourists have settled on a […]
title: Stokes Defends Bold Ashes Prep as England Chase First Win in Australia Since 2011

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: Australia has now inked or upgraded security deals with Singapore, India, Papua New Guinea, and Indonesia.
title: New Treaty Commits Australia, Indonesia to Joint Action if Security Threatened

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: Mike Burgess says Beijing’s intent has shifted from espionage to sabotage, with billions in losses already recorded.
title: Australian Spy Chief Warns Chinese Hackers Trying to Breach Critical Networks

author: Reuters
description: MOSCOW—Russia’s Federal Security Service (FSB) said it had foiled a plot by Ukrainian and British spies to tempt Russian pilots to steal a MiG-31 jet armed with a Kinzhal hypersonic missile for $3 million, state media reported on Tuesday. The RIA news agency cited the FSB as saying that the hijacked jet was to be […]
title: Russia Says It Foiled Ukrainian-British Plot to Steal a Mig-31 Jet, State Media Reports

author: Aldgra Fredly
description: President Gustavo Petro has condemned U.S. military strikes on Caribbean drug boats, widening the dispute over Washington’s anti-narcotics tactics.
title: Colombian President Orders Halt to Intelligence Sharing With US Over Drug Boat Strikes

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: Arkin Daniel-Reid tells MPs of death threats, stalking, and doxing during the 2025 campaign, urging tougher rules to protect candidates and their families.
title: Rape and Death Threats: Son of Former MP Zoe Daniel Tells Inquiry of Abuse During Elections

author: Kimberly Hayek
description: As the United States has deployed its largest warship to the Caribbean, Maduro’s regime is holding land, air, and naval exercises through Wednesday.
title: Venezuela Mobilizes Military Forces in Response to US Presence in Region

author: Monica O’Shea
description: 'There are no easy solutions to youth crime, and the best approach is always to stop crime before it starts,' the attorney general said.
title: Jacinta Allan Announces ‘Adult Time for Violent Crime’

author: T.J. Muscaro
description: Flight records showed their plane made four trips to or from Jamaica before making a stop in Fort Lauderdale.
title: Ministry Founder and Daughter Die in Plane Crash Trying to Fly Aid to Jamaica

author: PA Media
description: Asylum seekers can continue to be housed in the Bell Hotel in Essex after Epping Forest District Council failed to secure a High Court injunction that would block them from living there. The council took legal action against the hotel owner, Somani Hotels, claiming that accommodating asylum seekers there breaches planning rules. Lawyers for Epping […]
title: Bell Hotel Can House Asylum Seekers, High Court Judge Rules

author: PA Media
description: The UK’s jobless rate has hit its highest level outside the pandemic era for nearly a decade as experts said the further evidence of a weakened labour market made a year-end interest rate cut more likely. Official figures showed the rate of unemployment surged to 5% in the three months to September, up from 4.8% […]
title: Unemployment Rate Hits Highest Outside Covid Years for Almost a Decade

author: PA Media
description: Chancellor Rachel Reeves is due to deliver her autumn Budget statement on November 26. This will set out her tax, borrowing and spending plans for the year ahead, and also include forecasts for the economy by the Government’s independent forecaster. A range of economic news will come out between now and the Budget, which Ms […]
title: Autumn Budget: Timeline of Key Economic Data Before November 26

author: PA Media
description: A regulator has proposed that Wessex Water should pay £11 million over failures to adequately operate and maintain its wastewater network. Wessex Water and its shareholders will fund the enforcement package, according to initial proposals from Ofwat. It follows similar investigations and payouts from water firms earlier this year including Yorkshire Water, Thames Water, Northumbrian […]
title: Wessex Water Should Pay £11M Over Wastewater Failures, Says Regulator

author: The Associated Press
description: ANKARA. Turkey—A Turkish military cargo plane with 20 people on board crashed in Georgia near the border with Azerbaijan on Tuesday, authorities said, but they gave no immediate confirmation of feared casualties. Turkey’s President Recep Tayyip Erdogan and top officials from Georgia and Azerbaijan signaled that at least some of those aboard were believed to […]
title: Turkish Military Plane With 20 on Board Crashes in Georgia

author: Rachel Roberts
description: Outgoing Director-General Tim Davie, who quit following a damning internal report on bias, urged staff to 'fight' against what he termed the BBC's 'enemies.'
title: In Speech to Staff, BBC Boss Admits ‘Mistake’ Over Panorama Editing of Trump

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: New laws create a single planning gateway and enshrine housing delivery targets to speed approvals and cut red tape across NSW.
title: NSW Parliament Passes Planning Reform Bill to Fast-Track Housing and Major Projects

author: Chandra Philip
description: Health Canada has issued a recall for “laughing gas” that it says is being sold without authorization and presents a serious safety risk. Nitrous oxide, also known as laughing gas, is legal in Canada when it is administered by a health care professional, such as for dental surgery or medical procedures for sedation or pain […]
title: Health Canada Recalls ‘Laughing Gas’ Products It Says Lack Authorization

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: Remembering 50 years of his controversial dismissal Albanese said the statue will honour Whitlam’s 'vision, ambition and reform legacy.'
title: Albanese Commissions Gough Whitlam Statue at the Old Parliament House

author: Olivia Gomm
description: Finance Minister François-Philippe Champagne says his goal is to make Canada “the NATO partner of choice,” noting that refining critical minerals is “the name of the game” for becoming a competitive supplier. “Exploration, extraction is something, but what we need is refining. That’s the key,” Champagne told a business audience in Calgary on Nov. 10, […]
title: Finance Minister Says Refining Critical Minerals Is ‘Key’ to Becoming a Competitive Supplier

author: Olivia Li
description: Meanwhile, some orphanages in one province are seeing more adoptions as it appears that more Chinese choose to raise children without tying the knot.
title: China Offers Marriage Incentives as Decline in Wedding Rates Continues

author: Eva Fu
description: Behind sci-fi claims of a 150-year lifespan, references to ‘restoring organ functions’ and ties to notorious military hospital have medical ethicists worried.
title: China’s 981 Project: Dark Connections Behind the Quest for Longevity
